title: How to Choose an Airsoft Vest

steps.headline: Find a good Airsoft retailer or Tactical gear maker to buy your gear from.
steps.description: Don't be intimidated because there are many vests that can cost a huge amount of money

steps.headline: Decide what type of game you play.
After You decided what you are going to be doing and what you need your vest to hold choose a style of vest:
Once you have picked a vest, go crazy and order it !
steps.description:
If you ordered a M.O.L.L.E. vest make sure you order a whole bunch of pouches to be used on the vest{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/5d\/Choose-an-Airsoft-Vest-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Choose-an-Airsoft-Vest-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/5\/5d\/Choose-an-Airsoft-Vest-Step-4Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Choose-an-Airsoft-Vest-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

steps.headline: Before You skirmish, put on all your gear, and your vest and run around.
steps.description: Try to get the Vest worn in and practice speed reloading and finding certain gear without looking

steps.headline: You Are Done, Now Go out and have FUN!!

text:
Find a good Airsoft retailer or Tactical gear maker to buy your gear from. Don't be intimidated because there are many vests that can cost a huge amount of money Decide what type of game you play. Rifleman: prefers to use a Aeg, generally has multiple magazines{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b3/Choose-an-Airsoft-Vest-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Choose-an-Airsoft-Vest-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b3/Choose-an-Airsoft-Vest-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Choose-an-Airsoft-Vest-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Support Gunner: uses a Support weapon or rifle with large Box/Drum magazines{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3f/Choose-an-Airsoft-Vest-Step-2Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Choose-an-Airsoft-Vest-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3f/Choose-an-Airsoft-Vest-Step-2Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Choose-an-Airsoft-Vest-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Sniper: generally uses a sniper variant, carries a pistol sidearm, and a few magazines{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/58/Choose-an-Airsoft-Vest-Step-2Bullet3.jpg/v4-460px-Choose-an-Airsoft-Vest-Step-2Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/58/Choose-an-Airsoft-Vest-Step-2Bullet3.jpg/v4-760px-Choose-an-Airsoft-Vest-Step-2Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} After You decided what you are going to be doing and what you need your vest to hold choose a style of vest: Plate Carrier: a Plate Carrier is a very common and efficient way to carry gear. They are covered in M.O.L.L.E. webbing which allows the user to put M.O.L.L.E. pouches anywhere they want. Plate carriers can be expensive. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3f/Choose-an-Airsoft-Vest-Step-3Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Choose-an-Airsoft-Vest-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3f/Choose-an-Airsoft-Vest-Step-3Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Choose-an-Airsoft-Vest-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Cross draw Vest: Cross draw vests generally have all the pouches sewn onto them. It is common for them to have a zipper in the middle for easy removal. These types of tactical vests are probably the most common vest in use by Airsofters. They are also relatively cheap, and can be found relatively easy online. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/39/Choose-an-Airsoft-Vest-Step-3Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Choose-an-Airsoft-Vest-Step-3Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/39/Choose-an-Airsoft-Vest-Step-3Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Choose-an-Airsoft-Vest-Step-3Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Harness & Battle belt: Commonly used by snipers Harness' and Battle belts, have a belt that attaches around the waist and can have M.O.L.L.E. pouches attached. They are often lightweight and can be worn with a Ghillie suit. The Harness has suspender like straps that help distribute the weight to the shoulders. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5b/Choose-an-Airsoft-Vest-Step-3Bullet3.jpg/v4-460px-Choose-an-Airsoft-Vest-Step-3Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5b/Choose-an-Airsoft-Vest-Step-3Bullet3.jpg/v4-760px-Choose-an-Airsoft-Vest-Step-3Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Once you have picked a vest, go crazy and order it ! If you ordered a M.O.L.L.E. vest make sure you order a whole bunch of pouches to be used on the vest{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5d/Choose-an-Airsoft-Vest-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Choose-an-Airsoft-Vest-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5d/Choose-an-Airsoft-Vest-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Choose-an-Airsoft-Vest-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Before You skirmish, put on all your gear, and your vest and run around. Try to get the Vest worn in and practice speed reloading and finding certain gear without looking You Are Done, Now Go out and have FUN!! !
